column2: Dow profit rises 45 pct as margins expand April 23 Dow Chemical Co's quarterly profit jumped 45 percent
column3: helped by higher margins in five of its six units.

column2: Discount brokerage E*Trade Financial's profit plunges 59 pct April 23 Discount brokerage E*Trade Financial Corp's quarterly profit plunged about 59 percent
column3: hurt by lower commissions from trading services.

column2: Edwards Lifesciences 1st-qtr net profit doubles
column3: sales rise 13 pct April 23 Medical device maker Edwards Lifesciences Corp said on Thursday quarterly net earnings doubled due to strong heart valve sales and a positive impact from foreign exchange.

column2: UPDATE 1-Nasdaq to settle Facebook IPO lawsuit for $26.5 million NEW YORK
column3: April 23 In a first for a U.S. stock exchange
column4: Nasdaq OMX Group on Thursday agreed to pay $26.5 million to settle a class-action lawsuit involving its bungling of Facebook Inc's $16 billion initial public offering
column5: the plaintiffs' lawyers said.

column2: As sales of small cars dip
column3: Ford to lay off about 700 workers at Michigan plant DETROIT
column4: April 23 Ford Motor Co said on Thursday it will lay off about 700 workers at a Detroit-area plant making compact and compact hybrid cars
column5: responding to a dip in demand for such vehicles amid lower gasoline prices.

column2: Miner Freeport-McMoRan reports first-quarter loss on charges TORONTO
column3: April 23 U.S. miner and oil producer Freeport-McMoRan Inc reported a first-quarter loss on Thursday
column4: as it recorded one-time charges of $2.4 billion
column5: mainly for the reduction of the carrying value of its oil and gas properties.
